project.teaser: The outdoor environment has a significant impact on our health and wellbeing. The European Green Deal has introduced the ambitious commitment to a ‘Zero-Pollution Action Plan for air, water, and soil’ to protect humans and the environment. Evidence-based policy making on...
project.objective: The outdoor environment has a significant impact on our health and wellbeing. The European Green Deal has introduced the ambitious commitment to a ‘Zero-Pollution Action Plan for air, water, and soil’ to protect humans and the environment. Evidence-based policy making on environmental stressors is however hampered by the methodological challenges to quantify their socio-economic costs. The overall objective of BEST-COST is to improve methodologies for the socio-economic cost assessment of environmental stressors to i) enhance regular usage of economic and health modelling in policy impact assessments and policy evaluation; and ii) promote harmonised and consensus metrics for integrative socio-economic assessments of environmental stressors in Europe. BEST-COST will develop an improved and consensual burden of disease (BOD) framework for estimating the health impact of environmental stressors, with a focus on air pollution and noise and their interactions; an improved and consensual methodology for monetization of BOD estimates of environmental stressors; and a coherent methodological framework for assessing social inequalities in the socio-economic cost of environmental stressors. The methods will be co-developed with key stakeholders, made available as open access tools, and trialled in different EU countries. To ensure sustainability, transferability of the knowledge and methods developed by BEST-COST to other countries and stressors will be established. BEST-COST is conducted by a strong and unique consortium, gathering world-class expertise on environmental BOD assessment. The BEST-COST consortium consists of 17 organisations from 10 EU countries and the USA, and will be supported by an Advisory Board including representatives from JRC, EEA, and WHO. The consortium bridges the expertise from the Global Burden of Disease study, via the inclusion of IHME and key GBD collaborators, with that of national BOD studies, and will translate this expertise to EU agencies
project.title: Burden of disease based methods for estimating the socio-economic cost of environmental stressors
project.keywords: Environmental burden of disease, Health inequalities, Monetization, Air pollution, Noise

article.title: A framework for the impact of environmental stressors

result.title: Project Management Handbook describing the project management, risk management and quality assurance procedures and including templates for progress and financial reporting
result.description: The Project Management Handbook will describe the project management, risk management and quality assurance procedures and will include templates for progress and financial reporting.

result.title: Cluster newsletter 1
result.description: In collaboration with the partners of the cluster, a Newsletter will be published with a.o. updates on the progress and achievements of the projects and the interaction and synergies that were established between the partners and projects

result.title: Cluster web portal and visual identity
result.description: To raise awareness about the projects in the cluster, increase its impact and stimulate integration and cross-fertilization, a visual identity and associated templates will be developed for the cluster, as well as a public website and social media presence (Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn)

result.title: Plan for Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication - Update 1
Cluster's common dissemination and communication strategy
result.description: In collaboration with the partners of the cluster, a strategy for the dissemination, exploitation and communication of project activities and results (will be developed, setting out the various tools, channels and target audiences through which the cluster will share and exploit results.

result.title: Cluster brochure
result.description: In collaboration with the partners of the cluster, a brochure will be developed to present the different partners, their projects and expertise and as well as the aims of the cluster.

result.title: Policy strategy of the cluster
result.description: A policy strategy for the cluster will be developed and adopted

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The DMP will outline how collected, processed, and generated data will be handled during BEST-COST and after its completion, always pursuing data interoperability. It will outline: (a) how research data will be collected, processed or generated within the project; (b) what methodology and standards will be adopted; (c) whether and how this data will be shared and/or made open and /or can be easily found; (d) what legal, organisational and technical measures will be used to ensure its security and to safeguard the rights of individuals; (e) and how this data will be curated and preserved during and after the project. The existing ethical and legal frameworks (EU and national) applicable to the research activities in the BEST-COST project, in particular the use of health registries' data, will be reviewed.

result.title: Stakeholder engagement strategy
result.description: Develop strategy to promote, document and facilitate interaction with the different stakeholders of relevance to the project in order to ensure usefulness and usability of the novel methodological framework.

result.title: Cluster data management strategy
result.description: A common strategy will be developed to outline how data collected, processed, and generated will be handled during lifetime of the cluster and after its completion

result.title: Communication channels (website, social media) and visual identity
result.description: Based on the strategy set out in the DEC, EHNet will prepare the project’s communication activities by developing a visual identity and associated templates, as well as establishing a public website and social media presence (Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - BEST-COST (Burden of disease based methods for estimating the socio-economic cost of environmental stressors)
result.teaser: Climate change poses a significant threat to Europe, with environmental stressors like air and noise pollution leading to an estimated 400,000 and 12,000 premature deaths, respectively. To safeguard future generations, European countries must prioritize evidence-based policies...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Policy brief 1 for the cluster
result.description: In order to optimize synergies and increase the impact of the projects in the cluster a policy brief will be published at regular intervals

result.title: Plan for Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication
result.description: EHNet will develop a plan for the dissemination, exploitation and communication of project activities and results (DEC) , setting out the various tools, channels and target audiences through which BEST-COST will share and exploit results, updated according to partner and stakeholder feedback and monitoring The DEC will be harmonised with the data management plan (DMP) and will uphold the core focus on open access FAIR data and publications.

result.title: Scientific strategy of the cluster
result.description: A common scientific strategy for all projects in the cluster will be discussed and rolled out to increase the impact and possible integration of the projects and research

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
